results.title: Sunny munchy crunchy natural food shop
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, David Bairstow and Richard Todd
results.brief_description: If you are a health food buff, this film is for you. Even if you are not, there is still enough in it to tickle your fancy, perhaps strain your credulity. The camera scans shelves stocked with all manner of natural foods to which nary an additive has been added - soya bean and sesame seed products, wild honey, even eggs from hens fed on blackstrap molasses. But the real eye-openers are in what you hear from the store’s proprietor and his customers. (Award: Berlin.)
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, David Bairstow and Richard Todd

results.title: Sunny Iceland: land of the vikings
results.brief_description: Shows the life of the people of barren but surprisingly warm Iceland: the green-houses which use hot springs; and the major industries, fishing and whaling.

results.title: Sunny and the dark horse
results.creator_credit: AIAS Film Unit, Judith MacDougall and David MacDougall
results.brief_description: This is a companion to the documentaries ‘Stockman’s Strategy’ and ‘Collum Calling Canberra’. Sunny Bancroft, the Aboriginal manager of a co-operative cattle station in northern New South Wales is the central ‘character’ in what is the most narratively-oriented of the trilogy. We follow Sunny as he indulges his passion for horses by acquiring and training a galloper for the picnic races.

results.title: Sunless = Sans Soleil
results.brief_description: An unknown woman reads and comments upon letters she receives from a friend, a freelance cameraman who travels around the world. The cameraman asks himself, and his colleagues, what is the point of describing the world like this when he is always its instrument, and what part does memory, which he helps to create, play?

results.title: Sunfruit
results.creator_credit: Jackson Wain and Artransa Park Studios
results.brief_description: Records a visit by a school group to a pineapple farm in Queensland. Shows the harvesting and processing of pineapples, and provides information about the planting and development of the fruit. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Sunflowers
results.brief_description: An experimental film which admirably exploits the photogenic qualities of sunflowers. After a poetic opening a rapid montage of images links the flowers with the processes of birth, life and death,

results.title: Sundaze
results.creator_credit: State Film Centre of Victoria and Michael D. Carter
results.brief_description: A simple animated film of Anne Graham’s line drawings of a sunny day at the beach. Illustrates the variety of occupations people follow on the beach, and implies that a summer day by the sea is one of the best ways of enjoying life. Dis-orienting use of sound lends further interest to this unconventional sociological survey.

results.title: Sunday Too Far Away [DVD]
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation, Gil Brealey, Matt Carroll and Ken Hannam
results.brief_description: One of the few Australian feature films in which the narrative is centred on the portrayal of workers on the job - a group of shearers working on an outback station in 1955 in the months leading to the nine months shearers’ strike. While the gun shearer played by Jack Thompson is the central character, the focus of this episodic and unsentimental drama is on the communal values of the group rather than on those of the individual. Cinemaphotography by Geoff Burton. Cast also includes Max Cullen, Peter Cummins, John Ewart, John Hargreaves, Sean Scully, Ken Shorter, Gregory Apps.
results.creator_credit_for_label: South Australian Film Corporation, Gil Brealey, Matt Carroll and Ken Hannam
results.description: One of the few Australian feature films in which the narrative is centred on the portrayal of workers on the job - a group of shearers working on an outback station in 1955 in the months leading to the nine months shearers’ strike. Cinemaphotography by Geoff Burton. Cast also includes Max Cullen, Peter Cummins, John Ewart, John Hargreaves, Sean Scully, Ken Shorter, Gregory Apps.

results.title: Sunday Too Far Away
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation, Gil Brealey, Matt Carroll and Ken Hannam
results.brief_description: One of the few Australian feature films in which the narrative is centred on the portrayal of workers on the job - a group of shearers working on an outback station in 1955 in the months leading to the nine months shearers’ strike. While the gun shearer played by Jack Thompson is the central character, the focus of this episodic and unsentimental drama is on the communal values of the group rather than on those of the individual. results.creator_credit_for_label: South Australian Film Corporation, Gil Brealey, Matt Carroll and Ken Hannam
results.description:
One of the few Australian feature films in which the narrative is centred on the portrayal of workers on the job, tins this case a group of shearers working on an Outback station in 1955, in the months leading to the nine-month shearers’ strike. While the gun shearer played by Jack Thompson is the central character, the focus of this episodic and unsentimental drama is on the communal values of the group rather than on those of the individual.

Cinematography by Geoff Burton.

Cast also includes Max Cullen, Peter Cummins, John Ewart, John Hargreaves, Sean Scully, Ken Shorter, Gregory Apps.
description_for_label:
One of the few Australian feature films in which the narrative is centred on the portrayal of workers on the job, tins this case a group of shearers working on an Outback station in 1955, in the months leading to the nine-month shearers’ strike. While the gun shearer played by Jack Thompson is the central character, the focus of this episodic and unsentimental drama is on the communal values of the group rather than on those of the individual.

Cinematography by Geoff Burton.

Cast also includes Max Cullen, Peter Cummins, John Ewart, John Hargreaves, Sean Scully, Ken Shorter, Gregory Apps.
